event.title: emigrated to Tablas as early as 1730

data.event: Its first settlers were Onhan-speaking Negritos from Panay Island who emigrated to Tablas as early as 1730.
During the Spanish colonial period, Santa Fe was a barrio of neighboring Looc town until 1855 when it was established as a separate pueblo or town.

event.title: was abolished and reverted into a barrio again in 1868

data.event: It was abolished and reverted into a barrio again in 1868.
In 1892, the Spaniards restored Santa Fe's municipal status, which would remain until the American colonial period.

event.title: 10 March 1917, it was abolished and reverted

data.event: However, on 10 March 1917, it was abolished and reverted once more into a barrio of Looc.

event.title: 8 January 1940, by virtue of Commonwealth Act No. 581, authored

data.event: On 8 January 1940, by virtue of Commonwealth Act No. 581, authored by Romblon congressman Leonardo Festin, the municipality of Looc was abolished and incorporated into a new special municipality called Tablas.
